channel.title: [Project Insanity] New way to handle Commands

item.title: [Project Insanity] New way to handle Commands
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Grabbing from a collection by index has O(1) speeds. The only difference between this and a large block of if statements is minute differences in the number of instructions. We’re talking very very small micro-optimization that will make no difference. (Especially if both methods still use poor programming practice)

If you want to make things easier on the JVM use the damn else-if keyword! It saves it from having to check every single comparison and it gets to exit as soon as it finds the proper block.

Read full topic
item.source: [Project Insanity] New way to handle Commands

item.title: [Project Insanity] New way to handle Commands
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:20, topic:508802”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=627042.msg4263115#msg4263115 date=1363642987]
Did he srs say speed/performance are different things? They’re pretty much direct relations to eachother
[/quote]
Good performance = good speed
Good speed != good performance

so not quite in my opinion… I wouldn’t call them the same thing.[/quote]
But you can’t have good performance and not have good speed, which is my point. He basically said “Speed-wise, this is better, but speed-wise, this is better.”

“Speed wise, stacked-commands are better, performance wise, this is better.”

Didn’t know collection lookups had better performance than if statements/switch blocks.[/quote]
Did he srs say speed/performance are different things? They’re pretty much direct relations to eachother

item.title: [Project Insanity] New way to handle Commands
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:11, topic:508802”] case 3: commands.get(0).handleCommand(c, command); case 2: commands.get(1).handleCommand(c, command); case 1: commands.get(2).handleCommand(c, command); default: commands.get(4).handleCommand(c, command);

… er. That is not a very good way to handle this. :s

And your list should be final

This is pretty bad. Your naming is bad bot class wise and packaging wise.

Not like your shit is any better.

It doesn’t matter what his code is like, whether it’s better or not he’s still 100% accurate in what he’s saying. This code really wouldn’t handle much better than what the default command handling is done in PI. Credits to you for trying but you should focus on optimising this and making it comply with conventions.

Speed wise, stacked-commands are better, performance wise, this is better.[/quote]
Are we talking micro-optimisation or a big difference?

Read full topic

item.title: [Project Insanity] New way to handle Commands
item.dc:creator: @RsInFecTion RsInFecTion
item.description:
@RsInFecTion wrote:

I have always hated how all the commands were in one class. I found it very unorganized. So me and Austin decided to re-write it.

[color=red]Step One:[/COLOR]

In your packets folder make a new folder and call it “[color=blue]commands[/COLOR]”

[color=red]Step Two:[/COLOR]

In your newly made folder add these two classes. You will have to change the imports.

[color=blue]CommandPacket[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.PacketType;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl.AdministratorCommands;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl.DefaultCommands;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl.DeveloperCommands;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl.DonatorCommands;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl.ModeratorCommands;

/**
 * The command packet.
 * @author Play Boy & Frostbit3
 *
 */
public class CommandPacket implements PacketType {
	
	private List<CommandParent> commands = new ArrayList<CommandParent>();
	
	public CommandPacket() {
		commands.add(0, new DeveloperCommands());
		commands.add(1, new AdministratorCommands());
		commands.add(2, new ModeratorCommands());
		commands.add(3, new DonatorCommands());
		commands.add(4, new DefaultCommands());
	}

    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    	String command = c.getInStream().readString();
    	
    	switch (c.playerRights) {
    	case 3:
    		commands.get(0).handleCommand(c, command);
    	case 2:
    		commands.get(1).handleCommand(c, command);
    	case 1:
    		commands.get(2).handleCommand(c, command);
    	default:
    		commands.get(4).handleCommand(c, command);
    	}
    	
    }
}

[color=blue]CommandParent[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands;

import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;

public interface CommandParent {

	public void handleCommand(final Client c, final String cmd);
	
}

[color=red]Step Three:[/COLOR]

Now in the commands folder, make another folder and call it “[color=blue]impl[/COLOR]”

[color=red]Step Four:[/COLOR]

Add all the player rights command classes:

[color=blue]DefaultCommands[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl;

import org.ventus.game.Config;
import org.ventus.game.Server;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.CommandParent;
import org.ventus.game.utility.Misc;

public class DefaultCommands implements CommandParent {

	@Override
	public void handleCommand(Client c, String cmd) {
        String[] args = cmd.split(" ");
		if (cmd.startsWith("/") && cmd.length() > 1) {
			if (c.clanId > 0) {
				cmd = cmd.substring(1);
				Server.clanChat.playerMessageToClan(c.playerId, cmd, c.clanId);
			} else {
				if (c.clanId != -1) {
					c.clanId = -1;
					c.sendMessage("You are not in a clan.");
				}
			}
		}
        
        if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) {
            c.sendMessage("There are currently @blu@" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + "@bla@ players online!");
        }
        
        if (cmd.startsWith("changepassword") && cmd.length() > 15) {
            c.playerPass = cmd.substring(15);
            c.sendMessage("Success your new password is now: @red@" + c.playerPass);
        }        
        
        if (cmd.startsWith("yell") && c.playerRights >= 1) {
            String rank = "";
            String Message = cmd.substring(4).toLowerCase();
            if (c.playerRights >= 1) {
                rank = "@blu@[ Mod ] " + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + ": ";
            }
            if (c.playerRights >= 2) {
                rank = "@lre@[ Admin ] " + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + ": ";
            }
            if (c.playerRights >= 3) {
                rank = "@red@[ Developer ] " + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + ": ";
            }
            if (c.playerRights >= 4) {
                rank = "@mon@[ Donator ] [" + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) + "]: ";
            }
            for (int j = 0; j < PlayerHandler.players.length; j++) {
                if (PlayerHandler.players[j] != null) {
                    Client c2 = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[j];
                    c2.sendMessage(rank + Misc.optimizeText(Message));
                }
            }
        }				
		
	}

}

[color=blue]ModeratorCommands[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl;

import org.ventus.game.Config;
import org.ventus.game.Connection;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.CommandParent;

public class ModeratorCommands implements CommandParent {

	@Override
	public void handleCommand(Client c, String cmd) {
		
	       if (cmd.equals("ban") && cmd.charAt(3) == ' ') {
	            try {
	                String playerToBan = cmd.substring(4);
	                Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan);
	                Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan);
	                for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
	                    if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
	                        if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
	                            PlayerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true;
	                            Client c2 = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[i];
	                            c2.sendMessage(" " + c2.playerName + " Got Banned By " + c.playerName + ".");
	                        }
	                    }
	                }
	            } catch (Exception e) {
	                c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
	            }
	        }
	        
	        if (cmd.equals("kick") && cmd.charAt(4) == ' ') {
	            try {
	                String playerToBan = cmd.substring(5);
	                for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
	                    if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
	                        if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
	                            PlayerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true;
	                        }
	                    }
	                }
	            } catch (Exception e) {
	                c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
	            }
	        }

	        if (cmd.equals("unban")) {
	            try {
	                String playerToBan = cmd.substring(6);
	                Connection.removeNameFromBanList(playerToBan);
	                c.sendMessage(playerToBan + " has been unbanned.");
	            } catch (Exception e) {
	                c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
	            }
	        }		
	}

}

[color=blue]AdministratorCommands[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl;

import org.ventus.game.Config;
import org.ventus.game.Connection;
import org.ventus.game.Server;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.CommandParent;
import org.ventus.game.utility.Misc;

public class AdministratorCommands implements CommandParent {

	@Override
	public void handleCommand(Client c, String cmd) {
		if (cmd.equals("whip")) {
			c.getItems().addItem(4151, 1);
		}
	}

}

[color=blue]DeveloperCommands[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl;

import org.ventus.game.Config;
import org.ventus.game.Server;
import org.ventus.game.model.npcs.NPCHandler;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.CommandParent;
import org.ventus.game.utility.Misc;

public class DeveloperCommands implements CommandParent {

	@Override
	public void handleCommand(Client c, String cmd) {
		if (cmd.equals("test")) {		
			c.MysteryReward();
		}
		if (cmd.equals("spec")) {
			c.specAmount = 500.0;
		}
		
	}

}

[color=blue]DonatorCommands[/COLOR]

package org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.impl;

import org.ventus.game.model.players.Client;
import org.ventus.game.model.players.packets.commands.CommandParent;

public class DonatorCommands implements CommandParent {
	
	@Override
	public void handleCommand(Client c, String cmd) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

	}

}

[color=red]Step Five:[/COLOR]

You will need to change the import in “[color=blue]PacketHandler[/COLOR]”

That’s pretty much it. Feedback is appreciated. Don’t forget to thank if you use!

Read full topic
